page.title: 08HOUSING-TYPES-PRICES
page.content: The populations of Great Paxton and the Offords has risen sharply in the past ten years due to the building of many new houses. These have been mainly 3 or 4 bedroom detached houses and in 1985 a 4 bedroom one would cost around Â£60,000.In Great Paxton around 200 houses have been built and the population has gone up to 860. In Offord the population is 1090.The housing developements in Offord are smaller and more spread than in Paxton.Offord has many more older and more varied styles of houses than in Paxton.On visits to Offord we saw thatched properties,victorian houses, pre_1939 houses and modern detached, semi_detached,chalet bungalows, bungalows and terraced houses. In Paxton we noted four thatches.
